name: Zimbardo Time Perspective Inventory
description: A 56-item measure assessing individual differences in time perspective across five dimensions: Past-Negative, Past-Positive, Present-Hedonistic, Present-Fatalistic, and Future. Based on the theory that time perspective influences thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.
reference: Zimbardo, P. G., & Boyd, J. N. (1999). Putting time in perspective: A valid, reliable individual-differences metric. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 77(6), 1271-1288.
instructions: Read each item and, as honestly as you can, answer the question: 'How characteristic or true is this of you?'

questions.name: ztpi_1
questions.description: I believe that getting together with one's friends to party is one of life's important pleasures.

questions.name: ztpi_2
questions.description: Familiar childhood sights, sounds, smells often bring back a flood of wonderful memories.

questions.name: ztpi_3
questions.description: Fate determines much in my life.

questions.name: ztpi_4
questions.description: I often think of what I should have done differently in my life.

questions.name: ztpi_5
questions.description: My decisions are mostly influenced by people and things around me.

questions.name: ztpi_6
questions.description: I believe that a person's day should be planned ahead each morning.

questions.name: ztpi_7
questions.description: It gives me pleasure to think about my past.

questions.name: ztpi_8
questions.description: I do things impulsively.

questions.name: ztpi_9

questions.name: ztpi_15

questions.description: I get nostalgic about my childhood.

questions.name: ztpi_30

questions.name: ztpi_31
